org.prop4j.explain.solvers

Interface SatSolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SatProblem
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MusExtractor, MutableSatSolver
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSatSolver, Ltms, Sat4jAllMusExtractor, Sat4jMusExtractor, Sat4jMutableSatSolver, Sat4jSatSolver

    public interface SatSolver
extends SatProblem
    A solver for the satisfiability problem for propositional formulas. Uses a SAT oracle to do the actual work and only provides a common access point.
    Author:
    Timo Günther
    See Also:
    MutableSatSolver

    • Method Detail

      • getOracle

        java.lang.Object getOracle()
        Returns the oracle used for the actual solving.
        Returns:
        the oracle; not null

      • isSatisfiable

        boolean isSatisfiable()

        Returns true iff the problem is satisfiable.

        More formally, let f denote the current (possibly empty) problem. Those are all the clauses that have been added to the problem. f is a conjunction of n ≥ 0 CNF clauses fi. Each clause fi in turn consists of a positive amount of possibly negated literals fij:

        f = f1 ∧ … ∧ fn
          = (f11 ∨ … ∨ f1m) ∧ … ∧ (fn1 ∨ … ∨ fnk)
        Then, f is satisfiable iff there is a variable assignment that satisfies f (i.e. makes it evaluate to true). Such an assignment is called model.
        Returns:
        whether the problem is satisfiable

      • getModel

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean> getModel()
                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns any variable assignment that satisfies the problem.
        Returns:
        the model; not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the problem is unsatisfiable
